bib_record.title: Measurement of the (n,np+d) activation cross section with 13.4 - 14.9 MeV neutrons using a fusion neutronics source/JAERI

Fusion neutron source of JAERI, deuteron
ion beam is 150 milli-A, deuteron energy 350 keV
Pneumatic sample transport system was used to return
samples from irradiation to measurement position
-counting loss owing to true and random coincidence
-deviation in detection efficiency owing to the sample
thickness - about 2% for sample thickness 1.35 mm
-self-absorption of gamma-rays in the irradiated sample
Total error consists of quadratic sum contri-
* Error in low energy neutron contribution < 0.03%
* Error in neutron fluence rate fluctuation < 0.5%
* Error in efficiency conversion ration between close
* Error from contribution of interfering reactions <7%

EN-ERR - The uncertainty in the neutron energy at 10 cm
sample distance was estimated to be +-50 keV, and the
uncertainty at 3 cm was estimated to be +-150 keV.
Fusion neutron source of JAERI, deuteron
ion beam is 150 milli-A, deuteron energy 350 keV
Pneumatic sample transport system was used to return
samples from irradiation to measurement position
Samples were irradiated at the angles from zero to
155 degrees relative to deuteron beam. Effective
neutron energy was determined by Nb/Zr method.
The typical neutron fluence rate at 10 cm distance
from source is (0.8-1.8) x 10**8 n/cm2/sec. When cross
sections were very small and induced activities were
weak, the samples were irradiated at 3 cm and at 0,
45, and 70 degr. The fluence rate was
Stack target irradiation. Each sample was
